creator: michael.hawkshaw@bigfoot.com
text:
I recently upgraded to Apache 2.0.40 and have found that whenever I try to stop 
the Apache service, my computer will blue screen (Win2K, don't get a chance to 
see the msg). I can't see anything in the Event Log, but this is reproducable - 
I've tried it four times using both the Apache Monitor and Services in Control 
Panel/Admin Tools and computer crashes each time. Services says it can't stop 
the service. This didn't happen in previous versions, although I was unable to 
start/stop the service by left-clicking on the Apache Monitor tasktray icon - I 
would have to open Apache Monitor first. In the Apache error log I get this:

[Tue Sep 03 12:07:52 2002] [notice] Parent: Received shutdown signal -- 
Shutting down the server.
[Tue Sep 03 12:07:52 2002] [notice] Child 612: Exit event signaled. Child 
process is ending.
[Tue Sep 03 12:07:54 2002] [notice] Child 612: Released the start mutex
[Tue Sep 03 12:07:58 2002] [notice] Child 612: Waiting for 250 worker threads 
to exit.
[Tue Sep 03 12:08:22 2002] [notice] Parent: Forcing termination of child 
process 232 
[Tue Sep 03 12:10:58 2002] [notice] Child 612: Terminating 1878053456 threads 
that failed to exit.
[Tue Sep 03 12:10:59 2002] [notice] Child 612: All worker threads have exited.
[Tue Sep 03 12:10:59 2002] [notice] Child 612: Child process is exiting
[Tue Sep 03 12:18:20 2002] [warn] pid file C:/Program Files/Apache 
Group/Apache2/logs/httpd.pid overwritten -- Unclean shutdown of previous Apache 
run?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
This report is pretty predictable, you are running ZoneAlarm which is
  incompatible with Apache.  They have a bug on file, I haven't heard
  any updates about a fix.

  Other hints are recorded in bug 7932.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 7932 ***
